title: How to remove Google+ Birthdays from my Google Calendar - Quora

response.answer_text: Google Calendar syncs birthdays from "Your circles" in Google+ along with information from your Gmail Contacts into a calendar titled 'Birthdays'.   To modify this on desktop, do the following: Turn off Google+ birthdays Open Google Calendar.In the top right, click the settings gear Select Settings.Click Calendars at the top.Click Birthdays, and find the Show birthdays from section.Choose Contacts only to see birthdays from Google Contacts but not Google+.For additional instructions (iOS, Android) visit: https://support.google.com/calendar/answer/6084659?hl=en If you want to leave Google+ Birthdays enabled but curate the list of birthdays, do the following: 1) Visit https://plus.google.com/settings  2) Scroll to the 'Your Circles' section and click 'Customize'  3) Uncheck the boxes near the circles you no longer wish to see in your Birthday calendar.   4) Refresh your calendar and observe that the birthdays imported from Google+ are removed.

Google's built-in calendar lets you turn off birthdays from your circles, but it does NOT let you turn off the import of Google+ birthdays into your contacts. So if you have a contact with an email address that matches a Google+ profile then their birthday is forced onto your Birthdays calendar. Obviously this is annoying as heck, so I built a replacement Birthdays calendar without this problem: Better Cal - Remove Google+ birthdays
